### Exercise 1

a.  What is the most interesting lesson, guide, or piece of advice Tufte offers you in this chapter?

-   One of the most compelling pieces of advice Tufte offers in this chapter is his definition of "Graphical Excellence," particularly the principle of efficiency. He states:

"Graphical excellence is that which gives to the viewer the greatest number of ideas in the shortest time with the least ink in the smallest space."

b.  Tufte shares some of his favorite graphics in this chapter. Pick one (but not the one about the military advance on and retreat from Russia) and answer the following.

What page is your graphic on? \[Take a screen shot and include the image as well, if you can.\]

-   pg. 30

Why did you pick the graphic you chose?

-   I chose this graphic because it is a piece to show good quality of **data density**, where it contains 1888 numbers of data.

What encoding channels are used in the graphic? What variables are they associated with?

-   Time (x-axis), Temperature (y-axis), Normal Range (Area), Actual Daily Range (line of border), Precipitation (Bars)

What, if any, elements of the graphic would be hard/impossible for you to implement in Vega-Lite (given what we know so far)?

-   Composition of Layout: I do not think i can create one graphic composite with two different graph (main, and bar at the bottom)

What point is Tufte illustrating with this graphic?

-   Tufte uses this graphic to illustrate that graphics that are at their best when displaying large, complex data sets.

### Exercise 3

##### Step 1

List three things that are not ideal about this graph. What makes it challenging?

1.  There are two y-axis that are in different scale. This is hard to visualize the comparison of two different variables in one set-scale.
2.  The text labels indicating the single data is not in good position.
3.  The circle and line mark for the Response Rate is not well placed. The circle seems a bit off.

##### Step 2

For each of the three things youâ€™ve listed, describe how you would overcome the given challenge.

1.  I will use concat to set two different graphs for each completion and response rate.
2.  The text labels could be modified adjusting dy and dx under the mark type text.
3.  I will layer the marks (point and line) to precisely lay at the same point.

##### Step 3

Download the data. Create your visual that puts into practice the strategies youâ€™ve outlined.

```{r}
library(vegawidget)

'
{
  "$schema": "https://vega.github.io/schema/vega-lite/v6.json",
  "data":
    { "values" :
        [{"Date":"Q1-2017","Completion Rate":0.91,"Response Rate":0.023},
        {"Date":"Q2-2017","Completion Rate":0.93,"Response Rate":0.018},
        {"Date":"Q3-2017","Completion Rate":0.91,"Response Rate":0.028},
        {"Date":"Q4-2017","Completion Rate":0.89,"Response Rate":0.023},
        {"Date":"Q1-2018","Completion Rate":0.84,"Response Rate":0.034},
        {"Date":"Q2-2018","Completion Rate":0.88,"Response Rate":0.027},
        {"Date":"Q3-2018","Completion Rate":0.91,"Response Rate":0.026},
        {"Date":"Q4-2018","Completion Rate":0.87,"Response Rate":0.039},
        {"Date":"Q1-2019","Completion Rate":0.83,"Response Rate":0.028}] 
    },
  "vconcat": [
    {
      "height": 200,
      "width": 400,
      "title": "Completion Rate",
      "encoding": {
        "x": {"field": "Date", "type": "ordinal", "sort": null, "axis": {"labelAngle": 20}},
        "y": {"field": "Completion Rate", "type": "quantitative"}
      },
      "layer": [
        {"mark": {"type": "bar"}},
        {
        "mark": {"type": "text", "dy": -5, "color": "darkblue", "align": "center"},
        "encoding": {"text": {"field": "Completion Rate"}}}]
    },
    {
      "height": 200,
      "width": 400,
      "title": "Response Rate",
      "encoding": {
        "x": {"field": "Date", "type": "ordinal", "sort": null, "axis": {"labelAngle": 20}},
        "y": {"field": "Response Rate", "type": "quantitative"}
      },
      "layer": [
        {"mark": {"type": "point", "opacity": 0.8}}, 
        {"mark": {"type": "line", "opacity": 0.5}},
        {
        "mark": {"type": "text", "dx": 7, "dy": -7, "color": "darkblue"},
        "encoding": {"text": {"field": "Response Rate"}}}]
    }
  ]} 
  ' |> as_vegaspec()
```
